key_postures.title: Kamae
key_postures.description: Stand in hanmi stance, facing partner.

key_postures.title: Tenkan
key_postures.description: Turn 180 degrees, rear foot steps in arc behind.

important_notes.note: Keep center low throughout the turn.
Use hips to lead, not arm strength.

key_postures.title: Being Grabbed
key_postures.description: Partner uses both hands to grab one wrist.

key_postures.title: Extension
key_postures.description: Extend arm using hip and hara power.

important_notes.note: Coordinate breath: inhale to prepare, exhale to extend.

key_postures.title: Ai-hanmi Kamae
key_postures.description: Begin in matching stance with proper distance.

key_postures.title: Osae Pin
key_postures.description: Guide partner down in spiral motion to mat.

key_postures.title: Wrist Rotation
key_postures.description: Rotate wrist inward while controlling elbow.

key_postures.title: Kneeling Pin
key_postures.description: Bring partner down using wrist lock.

important_notes.note: Effectiveness comes from precise angle, not force.

key_postures.title: Hand Capture
key_postures.description: Capture partner's hand with both hands.

key_postures.title: Spiral Rotation
key_postures.description: Rotate hand in spiral toward centerline.

key_postures.title: Standing Control
key_postures.description: Maintain lock for throw or pin.

important_notes.note: Spiral must be continuous and connected to center.

key_postures.title: Forearm Grip
key_postures.description: Grip forearm with knuckle on pressure point.

key_postures.title: Pressure Point
key_postures.description: Apply pressure while maintaining arm control.

key_postures.title: Lead Down
key_postures.description: Use combined control to lead partner down.

important_notes.note: Pressure point is 1-2 inches from wrist on inner forearm.

key_postures.title: Knife Defense
key_postures.description: Grip wrist with thumb facing down.

important_notes.note: Reverse grip keeps knife blade away from you.

key_postures.title: Katate-dori Grasp
key_postures.description: Blend while securing wrist with both hands.

key_postures.title: Throw Completion
key_postures.description: Cut down with arm while stepping through.

important_notes.note: Iwama: hold hand like gripping sword in front of chest.

key_postures.title: Initial Entry
key_postures.description: Enter deeply past attack, hip connected to center.

key_postures.title: Final Throw
key_postures.description: Enter again while guiding head backward.

key_postures.title: Wrist Grip
key_postures.description: One hand on back of hand, other supporting.

important_notes.note: Use entire body to create turning force.

key_postures.title: Grip and Lead
key_postures.description: Grip arm and lead in arc.

key_postures.title: Rotation
key_postures.description: Uchi: under armpit. Soto: outside neck.

key_postures.title: Separation
key_postures.description: One hand to heaven, other to earth.

key_postures.title: Seiza
key_postures.description: Both sit in seiza, partner grabs wrists.

key_postures.title: Chudan Kamae
key_postures.description: Middle guard, tip at throat height.

key_postures.title: Raise
key_postures.description: Raise sword overhead in large arc.

important_notes.note: Cut comes from center, not arms.

key_postures.title: Opening Position
key_postures.description: Both in chudan kamae at proper distance.

important_notes.note: Thrust and footwork must be unified.

key_postures.title: Facing Staff
key_postures.description: Move to avoid strike or thrust.

important_notes.note: Jo has long reach, needs decisive entry.
Reverse grip keeps blade away from you.

key_postures.title: Receive Strike
key_postures.description: Blend and enter as partner strikes shomen-uchi.

key_postures.title: Apply Ikkyo
key_postures.description: Control elbow and wrist, guide to ground.

key_postures.title: Receive Strike
key_postures.description: Enter diagonally to intercept yokomen strike.

key_postures.title: Apply Ikkyo
key_postures.description: Control arm and guide partner down.

important_notes.note: Enter early to intercept the strike.
Use hip rotation to generate power.

key_postures.title: Break Hold
key_postures.description: Use body movement to disrupt grip.

key_postures.title: Apply Ikkyo
key_postures.description: Transition to ikkyo on one arm.

important_notes.note: Move the whole body, not just arms.

key_postures.title: Before Grab
key_postures.description: Turn before fully grabbed from behind.

key_postures.title: Apply Pressure
key_postures.description: Use wrist lock to control partner.

important_notes.note: Timing is crucial for this technique.
Keep elbow close to body during rotation.

key_postures.title: Capture
key_postures.description: Control wrist and transition to sankyo.

key_postures.title: Evade Thrust
key_postures.description: Enter off the line of attack.

key_postures.title: Control Wrist
key_postures.description: Transition to yonkyo grip on forearm.

important_notes.note: Yonkyo requires precise pressure point location.

key_postures.title: Control
key_postures.description: Capture wrist and transition to yonkyo.

important_notes.note: Find the pressure point on the forearm.
Gokyo is primarily for knife attacks.

key_postures.title: Break Balance
key_postures.description: Use hip power to break grip.

techniques.name_jp: 後ろ両手取り四方投げ

important_notes.note: Use grabbed hand to maintain connection.

key_postures.title: Break and Enter
key_postures.description: Use body to break hold and enter.

techniques.name_jp: 後ろ両手取り入り身投げ

important_notes.note: Smooth transition from strike to capture.

techniques.name_jp: 後ろ両手取り呼吸投げ

key_postures.title: Extend Ki
key_postures.description: Extend breath power through grabbed wrist.

key_postures.title: Control
key_postures.description: Pin with pressure on wrist keeping blade away.

important_notes.note: Gokyo is designed to safely disarm knife attacks.

key_postures.title: Capture Arm
key_postures.description: Control attacking arm with reverse grip.

key_postures.title: Apply Gokyo
key_postures.description: Pin with gokyo keeping blade away.

important_notes.note: Essential for knife defense from thrust attacks.
Partner rotates around their own center.
Use partner's momentum to initiate rotation.
Both uchi and soto variations exist.

key_postures.title: Break and Rotate
key_postures.description: Free one hand and rotate partner.

key_postures.title: Generate Power
key_postures.description: Use hip power to initiate rotation.
